newsitem.title: UK: PRESS DIGEST - London-based Arab newspapers - Dec 18.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - London-based Arab newspapers - Dec 18.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in two London-based Arabic-language newspapers on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The Palestinian Authority is planning to spend $20 million on projects to boost tourism.
- Canada is to grant a total of $60 million to Tunisia, Morocco and Algeria for development projects.
- Gulf Arab states' free trade negotiations with the European Union are due to resume next year.
- Lebanon needs about $1.2 billion to develop the country's road network, the public works minister said.
- A high-level Egyptian delegation began commercial negotiations with Saudi businessmen in Riyadh to diversify Saudi investments in Egypt.
- Yemen and the Netherlands signed a $62.6 million agreement to construct an electricity power station in Yemen.
